result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrell Andre Viverette

Defendant Terrell A Viverette in court.  Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court for Terrell A Viverette.  Attorney James C Griffin appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a calendar call.  Court vacates stayed bench warrant.  Defense filed Motion Challenging Sufficiency of Preliminary Hearing.  Court scheduled a decision hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Decision scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terrell A Viverette not in court.  Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court for Terrell A Viverette.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a motion hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Case adjourned for calendar call in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Calendar call scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Motion Challenging Sufficiency of Preliminary Hearing
Received and Filed: Status of Defense Motions

Defendant Terrell Andre Viverette in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for motion hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. State has no objection. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Terrell Andre Viverette in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom/OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a motion hearing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Terrell Andre Viverette in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a motion hearing date. Defense to file any motions by 04-15-2022. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING  (16 pages) commencing 02-04-22  by KATHERINE NELSON

Defendant Terrell Andre Viverette in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by parties that case incorrectly tabbed to Branch 28. Due to lower pending cases, this case now assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Discharge Report dated February 22 (sic), 2022 - received

Defendant Terrell Andre Viverette in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terrell Andre Viverette appeared by video means with Attorney.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Sheriff's Deputy Nicholas Jaecks.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Arraignment scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated February 3, 2022 - received

No driving without a valid license.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Terrell Andre Viverette in court with Attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defense motion to dismiss.   Court hears argument.  For reasons as set forth, Court DENIES defense 's motion.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
*This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 1/19/22 @ 1p
